name: Pope Innocent VIII
summary: Innocent VIII, born Giovanni Battista Cybo, was Pope from 1484 to 1492. He issued the bull Summis desiderantes affectibus in 1484, which gave authorization for the persecution of witches and helped initiate the witch hunts. He had conflicts with King Ferrante of Naples and worked to maintain papal authority in Italy. He was known for his nepotism and for having illegitimate children before becoming pope. His pontificate occurred during the Renaissance period and was marked by political intrigue and corruption.
